intro: Palafoxia integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and have smooth edges, while its flowers are small and yellowish. It plays a role in supporting local wildlife, particularly insects and birds.
